**Creating a 10K Training Plan:**

Considering your current fitness level and available training time, I'll create a 12-week training plan to help you reach your goal. Please note that this plan is tailored to a beginner runner, and it's essential to listen to your body and adjust the plan as needed.

**Weeks 1-4: Building a Foundation (Weeks 1-4)**

* Goal: Build endurance and introduce running
* Workout schedule: 4 times a week, with one longer walk/run on the weekends
* Workouts:
	+ Monday: 30-minute walk during lunch break
	+ Tuesday: 20-minute walk + 5-minute jog/ walk (repeat for a total of 30 minutes)
	+ Thursday: 30-minute walk during lunch break
	+ Saturday: 30-minute walk + 10-minute jog/walk (repeat for a total of 40 minutes)
* Distance: 1.5-2 miles per session, with a total weekly distance of 6-8 miles

**Weeks 5-8: Building Endurance (Weeks 5-8)**

* Goal: Increase endurance and introduce interval training
* Workout schedule: 4 times a week, with one longer run on the weekends
* Workouts:
	+ Monday: 30-minute walk during lunch break
	+ Tuesday: 20-minute walk + 10-minute jog (5 minutes easy, 5 minutes fast) + 10-minute walk
	+ Thursday: 30-minute walk during lunch break
	+ Saturday: 35-minute walk + 15-minute jog (5 minutes easy, 5 minutes fast, 5 minutes easy) + 10-minute walk
* Distance: 2-2.5 miles per session, with a total weekly distance of 8-10 miles

**Weeks 9-12: Building Distance (Weeks 9-12)**

* Goal: Increase distance and intensity
* Workout schedule: 4 times a week, with one longer run on the weekends
* Workouts:
	+ Monday: 30-minute walk during lunch break
	+ Tuesday: 20-minute walk + 15-minute jog (5 minutes easy, 5 minutes fast, 5 minutes easy) + 10-minute walk
	+ Thursday: 30-minute walk during lunch break
	+ Saturday: 40-minute walk + 20-minute jog (5 minutes easy, 5 minutes fast, 5 minutes easy, 5 minutes fast) + 10-minute walk
* Distance: 2.5-3.5 miles per session, with a total weekly distance of 10-12 miles

**Additional Tips:**

* Start with a dynamic warm-up (5-10 minutes) before each workout, including light jogging, stretching, and mobility exercises.
* Incorporate strength training exercises 2-3 times a week to target your core, glutes, and legs. Focus on exercises like squats, lunges, deadlifts, and leg press.
* Pay attention to your body and take rest days as needed. If you experience any pain or discomfort, stop and consult with a medical professional.
* Incorporate proper nutrition and hydration to support your training. Aim to fuel your body with a balanced diet, and stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water.
* Get comfortable with your gear, including a good pair of running shoes, socks, and clothing.

**Tracking Progress:**

It's great that you're tracking your progress using a fitness app! Keep monitoring your calorie burn, distance, and weight loss. Use this data to adjust your training plan as needed.

Remember, consistency and patience are key. Stick to the plan, and you'll be ready to crush your 10K goal by the end of the summer!
